ygData.subject: FW: [eqbards] Bards and Enchanters
ygData.msgSnippet: I sent this some time ago, but my company changed my email address without me realizing it.  This got rejected by egroups because of that. ... From: Daryl
ygData.messageBody:
I sent this some time ago, but my company changed my email address without
me realizing it. This got rejected by egroups because of that.

-----Original Message-----
From: Daryl Schwemley
Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 4:04 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bards and Enchanters


I'm in Ytrilynth's Horde. I'm the only bard in the guild who is a primary,
but the guild bard I was grouped with last night has been playing a lot
recently (his primary is a druid), and we have a couple other lower level
bards who play every once in a while.

Three bards was a blast. We had one bard doing all instrument CoD, HoR,
DDD. Another doing Warmth, Anthem, Bellow. And I was doing Binding,
Chains, and Bellow. We weren't fighting any casters, and I was the highest
level bard in the group, so those seem to be the best twists.

Myself and the guild bard were using weapons (he has dual yaks -- twink!).
The only song I think that we could have changed was Anthem for Chant of
Battle, but we still had ALOT of fun. ;-)

We were constant pull the whole time in Lake of Ill Omen. I ended up making
a bub in about 45min or so before the group broke up because of people
needing to do homework.

Gilgurth
Bard of 26 Winces
E'ci

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 3:29 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bards and Enchanters
>
>
> Heh heh, yeah that is definitely true. I have been in a lot
> of groups with
> two bards and it is great. I'd love to get in a group with
> Galtin and you
> sometime I think we would be very deadly. Although I think
> the enchanter
> would have found that using his two very cheap stun spells
> would have even
> made the slaughter more amusing. Three bards would
> definitely be a hoot,
> good grief think of the clarity effects at 32! Three bards
> and two nukers
> with an enchanter would be scary indeed. I don't think two
> many servers
> have as many bards as we do on E'ci though. What guild are
> you in Gilgurth?
> I know between DoH, Armigers, and Grail Brotherhood we have
> almost a dozen
> bards over level 25.
>
> Kitasi Faegehearper
> Armigers of Mirth
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Daryl Schwemley [mailto:drs@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 2:27 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: [eqbards] Bards and Enchanters
>
>
> Since some people think we bards are very limited when
> grouped with bards, I
> thought I would relate what happened to me Tuesday night.
>
> When I logged in, two of my guildmates (bard and enchanter)
> were grouped
> together with a warrior and another bard. I was invited to
> join them. So
> our group was 3 bards, warrior, and enchanter. All of us
> bards were around
> level 25, so it worked out where we actually had enough songs
> for all of us
> to twist 3 songs each.
>
> The enchanter was giving everyone alacrity, but other than
> that, he was just
> medding. Why? There was nothing else for him to really do.
> He commented
> on that at one point, and my fellow bard guildmate said,
> "Sit, med, enjoy
> the ride!" ;-)
>
> So, in this group, it wasn't the bard who was useless, it was
> the enchanter.
> Just thought it was funny.
>
> Gilgurth
> Bard of 26 Winces
> E'ci
>
